result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evans Ramle Vilme

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant Evans Ramle Vilme appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Evans Ramle Vilme.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson waives the formal reading and stand mute on EV behalf.  Attorney Erickson asks for a status within 30 days.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant Evans Ramle Vilme appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Evans Ramle Vilme.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson provides the court with a waiver of the preliminary hearing. Court goes over the preliminary hearing waiver with EV. Court binds over. Attorney Harper asks for an arraignment date; 30 days out. Attorney Erickson states that EV is on a high cash bond and would like to get it done as soon as possible.
Arraignment scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Defendant Evans Ramle Vilme in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson has received the complaint in court. Max penalties given. Attorney Erickson waives the formal reading of the complaint and asks for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Harper states that she needs to speak with the alleged victim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:07 AM Defendant Evans R Vilme appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Forehand appears in person for the state on behalf of Attorney Harper. Attorney Erickson appears specially in person. Court speaks about the high cash bond. Attorney Erickson states that he will be taking on this case. Attorney Forehand states that this was Attorney Harper's case and doesn't know when the complaint will be filed. Attorney Erickson states that EV can call him this afternoon at 4 PM.

11:10 AM Attorney Harper  appears in court and states that there are a few things that need to be done before the complaint to be filed and asks for a reset for Friday. Court resets.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:06 AM Defendant Evans R Vilme in court, in custody, without custody. District Attorney Jennifer Harper appeared for the State. Def has called SPD; SPD told him he qualifies and they would be trying to appoint. Court sets this matter over; asks the State when a complaint can be filed. DA Harper states VWC needs to contact statutory victim who lives out of state; notes Def is also from out of state; DA plans to file the complaint by tomorrow. Court adjourns this matter til 9/28 at 11 a.m.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:15 PM Defendant Evans R Vilme appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appeared in the courtroom. EV doesn't have an attorney and hasn't called the public defenders office.

Attorney Harper asks for $10,000 cash plus no contact with HCD or her residence.

EV states that he doesn't have an address and is homeless.

Court orders $10,000 cash bond. Conditions: No contact with HCD or her residence.

Court instructs Defendant to call the public defenders office. 

Initial set for 09/27/22 at 9 AM.
